test-case.test: ($staff/staff[1]/employee[1]/empnum[1] follows-or-is $works/works[1]/employee[1]/empnum[1]) and ($staff/staff[1]/employee[1]/empnum[1] follows-or-is $works/works[1]/employee[2]) and ($staff/staff[1]/employee[2] follows-or-is $works/works[1]/employee[1]/empnum[1]) and ($staff/staff[1]/employee[2] follows-or-is $works/works[1]/employee[2]) or ($works/works[1]/employee[1]/empnum[1] follows-or-is $staff/staff[1]/employee[1]/empnum[1]) and ($works/works[1]/employee[1]/empnum[1] follows-or-is $staff/staff[1]/employee[2]) and ($works/works[1]/employee[2] follows-or-is $staff/staff[1]/employee[1]/empnum[1]) and ($works/works[1]/employee[2] follows-or-is $staff/staff[1]/employee[2])

test-case.name: follows-or-is-30
test-case.description: Looks like an incomplete 'follows-or-is' operator, but this is not a parse error(XPST0003), because it is a valid function call, although to a nonexistent function. 'follows-or-is' is not a reserved function name.

test-case.description: Ensure node identity is is correct for variables and element constructors.

test-case.description: Only one comparison per expression, unless parenthesized
